com.soa.message.header
Interface HeaderPart

public interface HeaderPart

This interface represents a single component of a message header. A single message header can have multiple values. Each value is represented as an individual HeaderPart holding a name, and an optional value, and any optional parameters associated with the value. 

 part    = [ ( value | param ) ] *( ";" [ param ] )
 param   = name [ "=" [ value ] ]

 name    = token
 value   = ( token | quoted-string )

 token         = 1*<any char except "=", ",", ";", <"> >
 quoted-string = <"> *( text | quoted-char ) <">
 text          = any char except <">
 quoted-char   = "\" char

Method Detail

getValue

java.lang.String getValue()
Get the value of this element/part.

Returns:
The value portion of this element/part without any parameters. This may be null.

getDateValue

java.util.Date getDateValue()
Get the part value as a Date

Returns:
The part value parsed into a Date, or null if it couldnot be parsed

getParameterNames

java.util.Set getParameterNames()
Get the names of all parameters associated with this part

Returns:
The set of parameter names for this part

getParameter

java.lang.String getParameter(java.lang.String name)
Get the value of a named parameter

Parameters:
name - The parameter name. Name lookup is case-insensitive.
Returns:
The value of the parameter or null if not found

getDateParameter

java.util.Date getDateParameter(java.lang.String name)
Get the value of a parameter prsed to a Date

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter
Returns:
The Calendar value of the parameter or null if it could not be parsed or found.

setParameter

void setParameter(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String value)
Set the value of a specific parameter for this part.

Parameters:
name - The parameter name. If the name already exists, this will override the existing value.
value - The value.

setDateParameter

void setDateParameter(java.lang.String name,
                      java.util.Date date)
Set a parameter to a Date vlue

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter
date - The value, which will be added as a String encoded using RFC 822 format.

toString

java.lang.String toString()
A convenience method to get the normalized version of this part with the name, value, and all of the parameters concatenated into a single string

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
